intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum var. hirsutum, commonly known as hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
